body: If you are bumping a topic and saying something that contributes to the topic, will it be locked? Because sometimes I want to make a new topic about the same thing as an old topic but I am not sure whether to just bump the old topic.
body_tagged: If you are bumping a topic and saying something that contributes to the topic, will it be locked? Because sometimes I want to make a new topic about the same thing as an old topic but I am not sure whether to just bump the old topic.
title: (QUESTION) Bumping

replies.body:
Technically you can, but there is a small minority of people who get heated about it.

Dont worry about it. It won't be locked as long as you contribute.

replies.body: It shouldn't be locked, but it also depends on the situation and how long ago the thread was created.
replies.body_tagged: It shouldn't be locked, but it also depends on the situation and how long ago the thread was created.

replies.body: If your post actually contributes to the original topic, it should be fine, even if it so would be a "huge" bump. As this is a <u>forum</u>, the <u>only purpose</u> is to <u>discuss</u>, what are you otherwise supposed to do here?

replies.body: As long as you contribute to the topic, bumping should not be a problem.
replies.body_tagged: As long as you contribute to the topic, bumping should not be a problem.

replies.body: Yes, it should contribute to the topic, but you shouldn't post a question on someone's AMA thread if it was made a year ago. If it was made a few months ago, you can still ask a question or talking about what was said in the OP, but not something silly like a small question on someone's year-old AMA.

There is no time limit.
You can bump very old topics as long as you're contributing to said topic.
